question: You are a code expert, please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the code you provide is executable when possible. Please help me implement the following requirements using SVG code: create a scene showing food or drink being poured from a teapot, pitcher, gravy boat, cup, container or bowl.

checklist.title: Is the SVG container and pouring vessel structure properly implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code accurately implements the main pouring vessel (teapot, pitcher, gravy boat, etc.) using SVG elements with proper geometric structure and proportions. The vessel should have identifiable spout, handle, and body components with realistic proportions. Score 0 if no recognizable vessel is implemented, 5 if basic shapes are present but lack detail, and 10 if the vessel includes all structural elements with proper scaling and positioning.

checklist.title: Is the liquid pouring animation realistically implemented?
checklist.description: Check whether the SVG animation accurately depicts liquid flow from the vessel using path animations, gradient effects, or particle systems. The animation should show liquid following realistic physics with proper arc trajectory, varying thickness, and natural flow dynamics. Deduct 5 points if the liquid flow lacks curvature or physics realism, and 3 points if the animation timing feels unnatural. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are proper visual effects and liquid rendering techniques applied?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the liquid uses advanced SVG techniques such as gradients, filters, opacity effects, or masking to create realistic liquid appearance. The liquid should have proper color, transparency, and visual depth. Deduct 5 points if basic solid colors are used without gradients, and 3 points if no filter effects enhance the liquid realism. Check for splash effects or droplet details for full marks.

checklist.title: Is the complete scene composition and environmental context established?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes a complete scene with receiving container, background elements, surface reflections, or environmental context. The scene should show where the liquid is being poured and include supporting visual elements. Deduct 5 points if no receiving container is present, and 3 points if the scene lacks environmental context. Give 10 points if the composition includes multiple contextual elements creating a believable scene.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the SVG code can handle different viewport sizes, browser compatibility issues, and animation edge cases. The code should include proper viewBox settings, fallback mechanisms for unsupported features, and error handling for animation failures. Code with strong robustness should work across different browsers and screen sizes, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no compatibility considerations are present, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes creative enhancements that elevate the visual experience (e.g., 1. Interactive pour control via mouse movement 2. Steam or aroma effects rising from hot liquids 3. Sound synchronization cues 4. Multiple liquid types with different properties). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant SVG elements that don't contribute to the scene 2. Overly complex animations that don't enhance realism 3. Excessive decorative elements that distract from the main pouring action. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core pouring visualization is obscured by unnecessary elements.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review SVG code organization, proper use of groups, definitions, and reusable elements. Check for clean structure, meaningful IDs, and efficient use of SVG features. Deduct 5 points if inline styles are mixed with presentation without proper organization; deduct 5 points if no reusable elements or definitions are used when appropriate; deduct 5 points if the code structure is difficult to maintain. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the visual design meet professional illustration standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows professional illustration principles: 1) Coherent color palette that reflects the liquid type 2) Proper lighting and shadow effects 3) Balanced composition with clear focal point on the pouring action 4) Appropriate level of detail without visual clutter. Deduct 3 points for each poorly executed visual element, 5 points for unrealistic color choices, and 5 points for unbalanced composition. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the animation timing smooth and visually appealing?
checklist.description: Judge whether the animation follows natural motion principles: 1) Smooth frame transitions without jerkiness 2) Appropriate animation duration (2-5 seconds for complete pour cycle) 3) Natural easing functions that mimic real liquid physics 4) Seamless loop capability if designed as repeating animation. Deduct 5 points for choppy animations, 3 points for unrealistic timing, and 5 points for jarring transition effects. The full score is 10 points.
